reviews.review_msg: Hands down one of the best profs in the Chemistry department. Dr. Leach explains concepts really well, considering that Chem260 is a fairly difficult course. His exams are fair, exams are made to make you think outside the box while also examining the material learned during the course. Would definitely take a class if Dr. Leach is teaching it.

Professor Leach has such a caring and loving soul.He is very understanding and knowledgeable and his classes were hard, but he tried his best to make everyone understand the concepts and calculations, his exams were long but fair. Class was definitely curved. If you have a question just go to his office and he will make sure you leave understanding

Better than Holdcroft but expects a lot from students and tries to make it seem like he's making things easier but tests very in depth.... AVOID if possible. Oh and no formula sheet for the final or midterm.
Never finishes on time. Final is hard. Take mund for Chem 121 instead. 100 times better.

Explains very thoroughly and goes over Lewis diagrams all the time. His demos were not as engaging as Holdcroft's but the ice trick was pretty cool. Lectures were boring sometimes and he frequently reviewed concepts from the day before and wasted a bit of time. Attend the tutorial where he goes over the practice final; explains in depth.
Final was quite fair; lectures can be a bit boring at times, but he covers material very thoroughly, and makes sure that students understand concepts that he is explaining.

He is very nice individual. However, he spends way too much time reviewing material from the previous class and he doesn't spend enough time going through the harder material in the course. His lectures aren't very engaging and there are a lot of people who fall asleep in his classes.
An excellent and super helpful prof, boring at times but is overall a great guy who cares alot about his students and is very good at teaching

He honestly cares so much about his students; he is the first professor I have had that asks at the beginning of every class "how is everyone, are there any questions, are we all good... etc etc."  Beware, his tests are very hard and unexpected from how kind he is, so be sure to study hard and take lots of notes on what he says, they help.
Bad lecture planner. He would explain things in great detail, which is great, but rushed the last part. His final was really hard and the practice final wasn't enough practice.

he was really helpful and wow do i ever know how to draw a lewis diagram now, but unfortunately you don't need to know how to do that for the exam so he rushed through the last part and his final was killer. really good prof other than his final

GREAT prof!  He really explained concepts well and he seemed really into it, and that he actually enjoyed the material he was teaching.  I'd recommend any class he's teaching!  He even cracks some jokes every now and then.  Overall his lectures were enjoyable to go to.

Dr Leach definitely knows his stuff and is very good at explaining concepts. That being said you should expect a lot of theory questions on the exam. Be sure to know your theory well and you should be fine.

Material is pretty hard but he explains very well. Goes into so much detail that he ends up not finishing the lecture notes. Also he often comes to class a couple minutes late with a starbucks coffee in hand.

Awesome prof but hard class.  Hopefully they will make CHEM 260 a pre-req instead of a co-req soon or else expect to have to self teach much of quantum chemistry during every lab report.  Dr. Leach was always super helpful if you went to see him though
LOVE Dr. Leach! Though the material was boring, he went through everything with us until we understood! Amazing professor! (Super nice too- brought candy for our entire class!)
The chem final was so hard that people started crying after. Need I say ANY more on that. Interesting class none the less.

There's a lot of material covered in CHEM 121 and Dr. Leach teaches it very well. He does a lot of examples throughout lecture and he does them explaining every step but because he does them in great detail, he rarely finishes his powerpoints. ITS OKAY THOUGH, he just picks up where he left off next lecture.

He's very good at explaining concepts, but that being said, the topics he covers are very difficult, so it does require reading the night before to at least get an idea of what you're doing.  Don't put all your studying off to the end!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
He's very good at explaining concepts, but that being said, the topics he covers are very difficult, so it does require reading the night before to at least get an idea of what you're doing.

Attending the lectures are mandatory. He goes over several examples to clarify the material. Must be prepared to self learn and do several practice examples. The final exam was fair and not as difficult as the midterm. Don't focus on memorizing the equations, there were no questions (that I recall) that required them. Be sure to study lots!

Too many repetitive examples, how many time can you go through a basic Lewis Structure. This caused last week for us to rush through a chapter that was heavily examined. With that said if you don't understand the course he was better for you than Holdcroft, just went at a dreadful pace for those who did understand, Lewis Structure=Chem 11 level

Good prof. Explains things well. Lecture attendance is a MUST. Final exam and midterm was fair if you put in enough time to study, otherwise this class will really destroy your GPA (not because of the prof, but because of the content).
Goes over lots of examples so you'll understand. Good prof overall
I found Leach to be very helpful. He reviews what you did the class before and he provides several examples, which is what Holdcroft was missing. Great prof, funny, easy to understand.

great prof! kind of boring because he reviews old material every class. but he makes sure that you understand what's going on. even has a review session at the end of the semester where he goes through a whole final exam. again, he's boring. but he teaches well

He spent too much time reviewing, first 10 mins of each class, yet never heat of formation, which came out of the blue to be heavy on the final. Excellent at explaining and useful demos, but a bit to easygoing with class yappers and computergamers. Final was fair, but challenging, except for the imbalance with reaction formation problems.

Fair prof if C+ and lower grades will make you happy but if you are aiming for "A" grade you shouldn't be taking this course with this man. Very  repetitive, not open to complaints and suggestions and extremely bad at responding back to emails.

Though enthusiastic, very boring, goes over last lecture's notes in the next class (repetitive for no reason), can be amusing to listen to at times, goes over examples during class that take a long time. Had him for second half of class, fair final. Never read the textbook during this half. Best to go to lectures to understand concepts better.

Very good at lecturing, does a lot of examples that help you prepare for the final, which, as others have said, was quite difficult and concept heavy. However, I personally thought it was the same difficulty as the midterm. All in all, Leach is a genuinely nice guy who seems to care about the success of his students. Highly recommend.

Leach is very nice and explains well, but his final was absolutely beastly. My friends were pretty upset after we were done. The final was very concept heavy, and covered almost no lon capa and no textbook questionsm even though Leach stresses a lot of those throughout the course.

Such a nice guy, and a very good professor! Goes through plenty of examples during class, and at the beginning of every class asks, "Are there any questions from last lecture?" He genuinely cares about the students, and was even nice enough to have a review session outside of lecture before the final. Not something most profs do. Great guy!
He is a very nice teacher. Tries to make the class very interesting. Study the textbook and his notes and you will get a very good mark.

Very enthusiastic prof! Tries to keep lectures interesting and goes through a lot of problems. Wasn't very clear on what he was going to include for the final though, so that made it hard. The final was hard and focused largely on concept questions.

One of the best chemistry profs! He is extremely helpful and explains everything very well so it is easy to understand the material. Midterms and final were very fair and covered lon capa questions as well as his lecture notes.
Good professor. Makes notes available ahead of lectures for easy note-taking. Did a good job covering some very detailed subject matter. Good control over the lecture hall.

Best prof. ive had this year. Much better then holdcroft. CHEM STUDENTS DO NOT STRESS!! you will suffer during holdcrofts insanely hard midterm but then leach always does examples and its more concept heavy than calculation focused...lon capas are much easier and you wont need to copy ur friends answers to make the deadline. Well done LEEEEECH

Leach is great. He goes through examples during lecture and encourages questions. He is constantly interacting with the class asking questions and waiting for answers to be yelled out. He wants you to learn his material and he does a great job teaching it. Bravo, Leach!
Pretty good prof...has good explanations and examples =) I like him better than Holdcroft...even if his experiments aren't as "exciting" as Holdcroft's lol
His explanations are very clear but I think he should spend more time on certain topics than others.

I cannot find a single flaw with this professor. I regret so, so much that I did not try harder for the final--he was infinitely patient, helpful, and everything that he explained was crystal clear. If he is teaching another course in the future I would definitely take his classes again.
Only thing bad about him is that he doesn't stop ppl talking in class, therefore the lecture hall is always very noisy. If you wanna do well you have to sit very close to him.
This is what I call a dedicated prof. He'll spend hours of his own time just to go over things like midterms for you, even though he's not obliged to. A rarity these days!

Excellent prof. Very excited about chemistry and always eager to help. There are no stupid questions in this class. He goes through lots of examples and thoroughly explains concepts. DO read the text; it is extremely helpful for understanding details. Be sure to attend lecture, as many notes are written on overhead and not posted online.

notes are very clear and detail enough to not read the text. lecture are very detailed and goes over examples step by step.. and so class is always overtime. very dedicated. he held a session to go over the practice exam qs. pretty good prof =)
He is so kind that makes me feel guilty if I didnt go to his lec .really knowledgable in chemistry .Make me wanna say Thank U at this moment...

It took about a week to get over the fact that the material he taught was really boring... HOWEVER he is an EXCELLENT teacher, he's very clear and explains everything in detail. By far if you have any question, he'd be more than happy to help. To do well, read the material before lectures, and read it again after lectures to do well in this class

Dr. Leach the half part of general chemistry is the BETTER half of it. I like the way he teaches the class he makes sure its clear and gives example questions which really helps. Overall, everything about Dr. Leach makes him a great prof :) some people just abuse his kindess which is rude.. He should teach the whole part of chem!!

Took this in Spring '06. One of the most useful I ever took in quantum mechanics and I owe it mostly to the fact that Dr. Leach was teaching it. He made the material quite clear, and his assignments, while complex, were great starting material for how his exams are structured (which I found ridiculously easy for the most part).

The most dedicated prof I've had in SFU.  Really knows his stuff too! This class is kinda hard for those who don't have any background in Quantum Mechanics, so it is better to take Chem 464, or perhaps Phys 385 first.  He takes a lot of material from Steinfeld's text; make it your bible for the semester and forget buying the required text.
he's a very nice guy...
